title: Ultra VNC compatibility
author: billymckendrick
body_snippet:
Hello,

I have a lot of machines that I manage using UltraVNC, that require both a username and password.

Would it be at all possible to add this in, as I'd find it extremely useful and would mean I am using mRemoteNG for everything!

Thanks,
Billy

iterations.description: Feature request to replace VncSharp with bundled UltraVNC client using the same external-process-embedding approach as PuTTY/SSH, which is a proven pattern in the codebase

comments.author: Benchwork
comments.snippet:
as a work around you can use the integrate feature to have mRemoteNG open the connection with UltraVNC.  not a solution, but it works ok for me.

Peter.

comments.author: tjgng
comments.snippet: I've done that myself but don't want to do +150 connections one at a time. UltraVNC has a launcher so I'm using that for now.

comments.author: kmscode
comments.snippet: We should plan on replacing VncSharp with a bundled version of UVNC.

comments.author: merarischroeder
comments.snippet:
In mRemoteNG, SSH works by opening Putty and then making the Tab-Container the parent of the Putty window. This same approach is likely possible with UltraVNC.

UltraVNC is freely available. So mRemoteNG should be able to download the client on demand.

Feasibility Prototype is required

- Install UltraVNC on your computer. Are there good command-line arguments so that you can open directly into a connection? [15-mins]
- Will the UltraVNC window be contained? Modify the SSH code so that i...

comments.author: robertpopa22
comments.snippet:

notes:
AI triage: Feature request to replace VncSharp with bundled UltraVNC client using the same external-process-embedding approach as PuTTY/SSH, which is a proven pattern in the codebase
Approach: Create a new UltraVNC protocol handler that downloads/bundles the UVNC viewer executable and embeds its window into mRemoteNG panels using the same SetParent approach used for PuTTY; feasibility prototype first before full implementation
